==Events==
*[[829]]  &ndash; [[Theophilos (emperor)|Theophilos]] (813–842), succeeds his father as Byzantine Emperor
*[[1187]] &ndash; [[Siege of Jerusalem (1187)|Siege of Jerusalem]]: [[Saladin]] captures [[Jerusalem]] after 88 years of [[Crusade]]r rule.
*[[1263]] &ndash; The [[battle of Largs]] is fought between Norwegians and Scots.
*[[1470]] &ndash; A rebellion organised by [[Richard Neville, 16th Earl of Warwick]] forces King [[Edward IV of England]] to flee to the Netherlands, restoring [[Henry VI of England|Henry VI]] to the throne.
*[[1535]] &ndash; [[Jacques Cartier]] discovers the area where [[Montreal, Quebec]] is located.
*[[1552]] &ndash; [[Conquest of Kazan]] by [[Ivan the Terrible]].
*[[1780]] &ndash; [[John André]], British Army officer of the [[American Revolutionary War]], is hanged as a spy by American forces.
*[[1789]] &ndash; [[George Washington]] sends the proposed Constitutional amendments (The [[United States Bill of Rights]]) to the States for ratification.
*[[1814]] &ndash; [[Battle of Rancagua]]: Spanish [[Royalist (Spanish American Revolutions)|Royalists]] troops under [[Mariano Osorio]] defeats rebel [[Chile]]an forces of [[Bernardo O'Higgins]] and [[Jose Miguel Carrera]].
*[[1835]] &ndash; The [[Texas Revolution]] begins with the [[Battle of Gonzales]]: [[Mexico|Mexican]] soldiers attempt to disarm the people of [[Gonzales, Texas]], but encounter stiff resistance from a hastily assembled militia.
*[[1864]] &ndash; [[American Civil War]]: [[Battle of Saltville I|Battle of Saltville]] &ndash; [[United States|Union]] forces attack [[Saltville, Virginia]], but are defeated by [[Confederate States of America|Confederate]] troops.
*[[1889]] &ndash; In [[Colorado]], [[Nicholas C. Creede|Nicholas Creede]] strikes it rich in silver during the last great silver boom of the American [[Old West]].
*[[1919]] &ndash; [[President of the United States|U.S. President]] [[Woodrow Wilson]] suffers a massive stroke, leaving him partially [[paralysis|paralyzed]].
*[[1925]] &ndash; [[John Logie Baird]] performs the first test of a working [[television]] system.
*[[1928]] &ndash; The "[[Prelature]] of the [[Christian cross|Holy Cross]] and the Work of God", commonly known as ''[[Opus Dei]]'', is founded by [[Saint]] [[Josemaría Escrivá]].
*[[1937]] &ndash; [[Dominican Republic]] strongman [[Rafael Trujillo]] orders the [[Parsley Massacre|execution of the Haitian population]] living within the borderlands; approximately 20,000 are killed over the next five days.
*[[1941]] &ndash; [[World War II]]: In [[Operation Typhoon]], [[Germany]] begins an all-out offensive against [[Moscow]].
*[[1942]] &ndash; World War II: Ocean Liner {{RMS|Queen Mary}} accidentally rams and sinks her own escort ship, {{HMS|Curacoa|D41|6}}, off the coast of Ireland.
*[[1944]] &ndash; World War II: German troops end the [[Warsaw Uprising]].
*[[1950]] &ndash; ''[[Peanuts]]'' by [[Charles M. Schulz]] is first published
*[[1958]] &ndash; [[Guinea]] declares its independence from [[France]].
*[[1959]] &ndash; The anthology series [[The Twilight Zone (1959 TV series)|The Twilight Zone]] premieres on [[CBS]] television.
*[[1967]] &ndash; [[Thurgood Marshall]] is sworn in as the first [[African-American]] justice of [[Supreme Court of the United States|United States Supreme Court]].
*[[1967]] &ndash; [[The Beatles]] begin recording their last 1967 single, [[Hello, Goodbye]]. 
*[[1968]] &ndash; A peaceful student demonstration in [[Mexico City]] culminates in the [[Tlatelolco massacre]] by the order of the president, [[Gustavo Díaz Ordaz]], to the soldiers of killing unarmed students, hiding the event from the public eye. The [[1968 Summer Olympics]] hosted in Mexico City, started 10 days after the massacre. 
*[[1970]] &ndash; A plane carrying the [[Wichita State University]] football team, administrators, and supporters [[Wichita State University football team plane crash|crashes]] in [[Colorado]] killing 31 people.
*[[1979]] &ndash; [[Pope John Paul II]] denounces all forms of [[concentration camp]]s and [[torture]] while speaking at the [[U.N.]] in [[New York City]].
*[[1980]] &ndash; [[Michael Myers (politician)|Michael Myers]] becomes the first member of either chamber of Congress to be [[Expulsion from the United States Congress|expelled]] since the [[American Civil War|Civil War]]
*[[1990]] &ndash; [[Xiamen Airlines]] Flight 8301 is hijacked and lands at [[Guangzhou]], where it [[Guangzhou Baiyun aircraft collision|crashes]] into two other airliners on the ground, killing 128.
*[[1992]] &ndash; The [[Carandiru Massacre]] takes place after a riot in the [[Carandiru Penitentiary]] in [[São Paulo]], [[Brazil]].
*[[1996]] &ndash; The [[Freedom of Information Act (United States)|Electronic Freedom of Information Act Amendments]] are signed by U.S. President [[Bill Clinton]].
*  1996   &ndash; [[Aeroperú Flight 603]], a [[Boeing 757]], crashes into the [[Pacific Ocean]] shortly after takeoff from [[Lima, Peru]], killing 70.
*[[2001]] &ndash; [[NATO]] backs U.S. military strikes following [[9/11]].
*[[2002]] &ndash; The [[Beltway sniper attacks]] begin, extending over three weeks.
*[[2005]] &ndash; [[Ethan Allen boating accident]]: The ''Ethan Allen'' tour boat capsizes on [[Lake George (New York)|Lake George]] in [[Upstate New York]], killing twenty people.
*[[2006]] &ndash; Five school girls are murdered by [[Charles Carl Roberts]] in a [[Amish school shooting|shooting at an Amish school]] in [[Nickel Mines, Pennsylvania]] before Roberts commits [[suicide]].
*[[2007]] &ndash; President [[Roh Moo-hyun]] of [[South Korea]] walks across the [[Military Demarcation Line]] into [[North Korea]] on his way to the second [[Inter-Korean Summit]] with North Korean leader [[Kim Jong Il]].
